title: Item Set bugged?
body: Hey guys, so I can save/create/delete item sets, but when I create an item set, I can't drag anything into them. Anyone else getting this bug?

replies.body: This only happens to Mac users, especially fi you got the update 10.12 Sierra, already sent a ticket to riot about it, lets just see what they say

> [{quoted}](name=Wast3land ,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=mtmsg8pk,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-10T14:34:03.906+0000)
>
> This only happens to Mac users, especially fi you got the update 10.12 Sierra, already sent a ticket to riot about it, lets just see what they say

I see, yeah I have BootCamp and Windows on it and the item sets work there.

> [{quoted}](name=LevvyLeviticus,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=mtmsg8pk,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-11-10T21:01:45.257+0000)
>
> Could be because they're revoking the item set choice as only 3% of players used it.

Only 3%? Damn, I thought it was quite common, it's really good since there's literally 100% customization for itemization, makes things quicker.

Item Sets aren't being revoked, they'll just take a little to re-implement after beta client rolls out. You'll still be able to use item sets created in the legacy client in the meantime.

Sounds like your bug is in the legacy client though, I'm afraid I can't help you there as I dunno what would cause this. I'd recommend either posting over in Help and Support so our wrenchmen see it, or submitting a support ticket as player support should also be able to help you.
Could be because they're revoking the item set choice as only 3% of players used it.

> WILL THE UPDATED CLIENT HAVE THE SAME FEATURES AS THE CURRENT CLIENT?
> The updated client is where we'll release all new client features (like Replays), and there are a few things that may take a few patches to to re-implement after open beta gets going. One feature that isn't being immediately brought over from the legacy client are item sets. However, your existing item sets will still continue to work and our third-party API will still allow you to download custom item sets from community developers for in-game use.
